sentences.en: A later stature may abrogate an earlier law with which it conflicts.
sentences.cn: 新制定的法律可以使与之相矛盾的旧法律失去效力.

sentences.en: Both governments voted to abrogate the treaty.
sentences.cn: 两国政府均投票通过废除这项条约。

sentences.en: The next prime minister could abrogate the treaty.
sentences.cn: 下一任首相可能会废除这个条约。

sentences.en: When can we abrogate the national boundaries all over the world?
sentences.cn: 我要向全球发问,什么时候可以在全球取消国界?

trans.tran_en: to officially end a legal agreement, practice etc

trans.tran_cn: 废除（法律等），取消，去掉，抛开
trans.tran_en: to officially end a legal agreement, practice etc
